title: DCF77 Time Receiver Function Block
description: This function block processes DCF77 time signals and updates the real-time clock (RTC) with data obtained from the DCF77 signal. It handles signal reception, time decoding, and generates output signals indicating the current date and time. The block manages synchronization, daylight saving time adjustments, and error conditions that may arise from invalid signals.
name: DCF77

input.name: REC
input.description: Reception signal indicating whether a DCF77 signal is currently being received.

input.name: SET
input.description: Trigger signal to set the RTC with the received time information.

input.name: SDT
input.description: Initial date and time to set the RTC on first power up.

input.name: DSI
input.description: Daylight Saving Time indication to control DST adjustments.

input.name: SYNC_TIMEOUT
input.description: Timeout duration to determine the validity of the synchronization signal.

input.name: TIME_OFFSET
input.description: Offset for time zone adjustments relative to UTC.

input.name: DST_EN
input.description: Enable signal for daylight saving time adjustments.

output.name: TP
output.description: Trigger output that indicates whether the time processing is active.

output.name: DS
output.description: Output signal indicating whether daylight saving time is currently active.

output.name: WDAY
output.description: Output representing the day of the week as an integer.

output.name: ERROR
output.description: Error flag indicating if an error occurred during the decoding process.

output.name: RTC
output.description: Real-time clock output that reflects the current date and time based on the DCF77 signal.

output.name: RTC1
output.description: Secondary RTC output, adjusted based on time zone and daylight saving time settings.

output.name: MSEC
output.description: Milliseconds elapsed since the last synchronization.

output.name: SYNC
output.description: Signal indicating successful synchronization with the DCF77 signal.
